revised_title: Invention for Giving Light in Explosive Mixtures of Fire-Damp in Coal Mines
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy invents a wire gauze-covered lamp that consumes fire-damp in coal mines, providing light without causing explosions. The lamp can be used in explosive mixtures of carburetted hydrogen and air, as well as hydrogen and oxygen, without igniting the mixture outside the lamp.
